subject: RE: [junit] Perform something before and after a complete test
msgSnippet: ... And more - a TestSetup can decorate any arbitrary Test instance, and therefore not only a TestSuite that aggregates all tests from one TestCase class, but
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>> The most straightforward thing would have been if I had two
>> additional methods in the TestCase: setUpTestCase() and
>> tearDownTestCase(). Both would be called only once, the first, when
>> the test (all test methods in a TestCase) starts and the last when
>> the test ends (all test methods in a TestCase).
>
> That's exactly what TestSetup already does, so there's no need to add
> that behavior to TestCase.

And more - a TestSetup can decorate any arbitrary Test instance, and
therefore not only a TestSuite that aggregates all tests from one
TestCase class, but also whole TestSuite hierarchies. The power of
Composite!

Regards, Ilja
